doc.previous: Many of Santo Domingo s most notable landmarks are located within the Zona Colonial district of the city a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1990 The Colonial Zone bordered by the R o Ozama also has an impressive collection of early 16th century buildings including palatial houses and majestic churches that reflect the architectural style of the late Middle Ages
doc.after: The city s most important historical buildings include the Catedral Santa Mar a La Menor called La Catedral Primada de Am rica America s First Cathedral which states its distinction the Alc zar de Col n America s first castle once the residence of Viceroy of the Indies Don Diego Col n a son of Christopher Columbus the Monasterio de San Francisco the ruins of the first monastery in the Americas the Museo de las Casas Reales in a monumental complex that includes the former Palace of the Governors and the building of the former Royal Audiencia of Santo Domingo the Fortaleza Ozama the oldest fortress in the Americas the Pant on Nacional a former Jesuit edifice now hosting the remains of various renowned Dominicans and the Dominican Convent the first convent in the Americas
